hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition via Yield Curve/BTC Correlation Break
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes (BTC 30-day volatility 30-60%), a breakdown of the 30-day inverse correlation between BTC and 10Y-2Y Treasury spread (currently -0.4 to -0.6) to near-zero or positive, combined with BTC breaking below its 50-day volume-weighted average price (VWAP), predicts BEAR regime transition within 7 days with 70% accuracy.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often precede directional breaks. The BTC/yield curve correlation represents macro sensitivity. When this relationship breaks during monetary tightening expectations, it suggests crypto losing its 'inflation hedge' narrative and transitioning to risk-off behavior. This preceded June 2022 and August 2023 bear transitions.
entry_conditions: BTC closes below 50-day VWAP on increasing volume (>20% above 30-day average)
Terminal rate expectations (Fed funds futures) increase by >25bps over 5 days
Crypto fear & greed index drops below 40

exit_conditions.take_profit: 12% gain (short position) OR regime classification switches to BEAR (confidence > 75%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC reclaims 50-day VWAP with volume confirmation OR 6% loss
exit_conditions.time_exit: 7 trading days without BEAR regime confirmation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Correlation breakdown signals produce <55% accuracy in predicting BEAR regimes OR average short returns are <5% when tested across 2020-2024 neutral periods.
